Senior Software Engineer.about-project-1: About the projectDo you self-identify as a great problem solver (not just a coder)?Have you been honing your innovation craft for years yet yearning for more complex challenges?Does the opportunity to play a key role in the launch of a software platform with massive impact (for millions or even billions of people) excite you?If youâ€™ve answered with 3 resounding yeses, then we want to meet you!What We ExpectWe are a cutting-edge web3 infrastructure scale-up project seeking a few very talented developers who are not just looking for a job but want to be challenged to accomplish great things in an exciting venture.We are the veterans of many successful startups and will put you on the accelerated learning curve toward your future success.
Senior Software Engineer.responsibilities-1: Your responsibilitiesThis position requires a great understanding of customer-facing tools, UI prototypes for partners, internal tooling, and experience in data visualization challenges in analytics dashboards.You'll be immediately challenged to take significant ownership of our front-end codebase and architecture.Once placed in a squad, you will design and develop Core components of our products on ReactJS and NodeJS. You will contribute to creating advanced, high-performance front-end and back-end blockchain and enterprise applications.About Cere NetworkCere Network is the decentralized data protocol powering the future of web3 with trustless content sharing and cloud data interactions between apps, users, AI/ML, and (NFT) assets. Cere is backed by the worldâ€™s largest institutions and projects, including Binance Labs, Republic Labs, and Polygon.Our EthosWe look for a few things across all hires we make at Cere, regardless of role or team:- We seek teammates who will thrive in our fast-paced work environment, where we default to methodical, simulation-driven, fast development iterations and a first-principle thinking mindset.- We crave teammates with high standards and strong discipline, embracing a growth mindset to continuously learn and incrementally improve habits and processes.- We require contributors to have excellent communication skills (esp. written), for everything must be well organized and tracked in Notion, Slack, Wikiâ€™s, etc. We want autonomous, goal-oriented individuals who embrace transparency and accountability. No one wants to micro-manage others.- We need good teammates who are generally cool people who want to be part of a great team & decentralized community where everyone truly helps and challenges each other to learn/grow by innovating together towards greater shared goals. Embracing the building of such a collaborative community is the only way we can sustain rapid innovation (and the only way to live/work, really).

Senior Software Quality Engineer.publication-dates: offer expired over a month ago
Senior Software Quality Engineer.about-project-1: About the projectRockwell Automation is looking for a Software Quality Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be highly collaborative, partnering with multi-discipline teams to establish and drive quality goals and objectives throughout the development lifecycle. Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills are a must to build effective working relationships across product management, program management and engineering stakeholders. You will provide ongoing visibility of progress to established goals through the collection, organization and analysis of project data. You will act as subject matter expert, coaching and mentoring teams on QA methodologies, tools, standards and processes in order to bring efficiency, consistency and maintainability to development projects. This position requires a strong quality background and experience in software development. Software Quality Engineer to join our global Quality organization. In this role you will become an expert in software product development lifecycle processes, act as a key stakeholder and customer advocate, and will help Rockwell Automation Software products achieve world class quality standards.
Senior Software Quality Engineer.responsibilities-1: Your responsibilitiesOptimize and implement software development processes and standards; collect and analyze product / process data to identify risks and drive process improvements. Identify quality criteria, setup quality assurance plan and assessment schedule. During the software development lifecycle, provide guidance, training, and assessments to the engineering team. Monitor anomaly data an prioritize with team to resolve. Review product documentation and version control methods.
requirements-1: Bachelor in Computer Science, Engineering with quality emphasis, or other related technical degree;
Experience in Software Quality Management / Quality Assurance;
Minimum of 3-5 years a Software Development Environment;
Experience with various agile methodologies (e.g. Scrum, SAFe. Lean StartUp);
Proven effective communication across all organizational levels;
Strong experience in QA tools, methodologies, and continuous improvement.
Experience as a business process architect.
Experience working with Cloud / SaaS (Software as a Service) development teams.
Familiar with data analytics, data management, and data regulatory compliance.

.NET Developer.employer-name: KMD Poland Sp. z o.o.About the company
.NET Developer.work-modes: full office work, home office work
.NET Developer.about-project-1: About the projectPensam A/S is a Danish pension company with around 500,000 customers on solutions concerning retirement, serious illness etc. Pensam has outsourced all IT operations and application maintenance to KMD, including hosting, development of new applications and technical integrations as well as maintenance of the existing code base.In November 2022, KMD launched a new core pension system- the biggest project in KMD ever.As a .NET Developer, You will be part of our Pensam AMS department, which is responsible for KMD Pension Industry Solution. You will become an extremely central person who gains a lot of knowledge about the entire solution, which will make you very valuable to the project. With this expertise, you will be able to contribute to the future design of new solutions as well as optimizations of old "legacy".In Pensam Department, our primary areas of responsibility are system integrations (using Neuron ESB); batch management that ensure communication between all surrounding applications in the overall solution (internal and external)- Using Universal Automation Center â€“ Stonebranch as Orchestrator and all other solutions which include a lot of standalone solutions such as web solutions, phone system, console programs, VBA Excel, Sharepoint, etc.Our Technology Stack:The solution is a backend system and Neuron ESB will primarily operate between system-system integrations which also involve DMZ (IIS proxy server) as an API gateway to third-party applications.Microsoft .NET Framework C#Entity Framework and ODataApiHow do we work?#Agile #Scrum #Teamwork #CodeReview #Feedback #BestPracticies #Team CollaborationNew tasks are defined in close collaboration with your colleagues, we follow SCRUM principles with two weeks iterations, with daily standup, planning, and retrospective. We have four major releases per year.Around 80% of your work will be maintenance and debugging.Azure DevOps is used as a task management system.We review pull requests before check-ins.We continuously adjust the internal collaboration process in the team, and everyone is welcome to contribute.Team consists of 7 people with technical backgrounds, all Danish.One developer is already onboarded on the Neuron ESB platform, and our manager has been the leading architect on the solution. So, you get all the support and help you need to solve your tasks.Server and software deployment will be handled by our DevOps and hosting team.Azure DevOps and fully automated CI/CD pipelineAzureAutomated testsNeuron ESBWCF, SOAP, REST,MSMQ and Rabbit MQAD and Certificate authentication
responsibilities-1: Develop and maintain the leading IT solution using your backend/full stack skill set.
You will be responsible for new feature development, support, and maintenance of our existing integration platform (Neuron ESB), which acts as a broker between internal and external applications.
Investigate incidents through logs and code debugging and manage incidents from customers.
Create new automated tests to be included in our CI pipeline.
Create deployment packages and release notes using Azure DevOps to send to the DevOps team.
Improve the existing codebase, data analysis, troubleshooting, and bug fixing.

.NET Developer.responsibilities-1: Your responsibilitiesAs a .NET Developer, you will work in a compact and self-managing team, where innovative applications are built with the freedom to introduce new techniques. You will be responsible for designing, building, testing, and implementing new (web) applications. You will write clean and reusable code in C# to ensure that your colleagues can make any adjustments. In addition, your code will of course be reviewed, and you will also review the code of your colleagues.As a person, you have a broad interest in technology, and you want to be constantly aware of the latest echniques. You will be working in a small team that interacts a lot with other teams (design, development & hosting).Tools we use: ASP.Net Core, EF Core, Azure Functions, Redis, Cosmos, Azure Storage

Senior Software Engineer.about-project-1: About the projectAs a successful Senior Software Engineer you will develop, build and improve the tooling to automate our platforms and services that reside in our multi-tenant, multi-datacenter, and multi-cloud infrastructure. You will deliver private and public cloud-based service offerings. You will build services to enable small teams the ability to operate infrastructures with diverse security, compliance, and customer requirements. Your platform services will support Acxiom developed services integration, automation, testing, deployments, and operations. You will write code to develop tools that support the full IT lifecycle. You will interact with users to define system requirements and/or vital modifications.

Collaborate with other engineers and architects
Operate the platforms and services you deliver
Provide sophisticated technical expertise, oversight, and accountability for outages
Closely partner with information security to ensure security compliance

T2P (Task to Production) developer for B.additional-module-1: About this opportunityWelcome to Nordea's Business Process Automation unit. We are +70 colleagues who add value to Nordea and Nordea's customers by driving the automation of business processes across the bank's value chains. As a T2P developer (Task to Production), you'll be developing and improving forms via which, branch employees report tasks to Operations.
T2P (Task to Production) developer for B.additional-module-2: Who you areCollaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best - and that we imagine you share with us.You'll join a multinational, collaborative and dynamic team with great atmosphere. Within our unit we have a wide variety of change capabilities including Project Managers, UX Designers, Scrum Masters and Application Managers as well as Robotics Product Owners, Developers and Controllers. The role can be based in Finland, Sweden, Poland or Estonia - preferably in Helsinki, Stockholm, Gothenburg, ÅÃ³dÅº, Gdynia, GdaÅ„sk or Tallinn.If this sounds like you, get in touch!
T2P (Task to Production) developer for B.additional-module-3: Next stepsAt Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

Software Project Manager.about-project-1: About the projectThe Program Manager is responsible for the on-time, on-budget, on-scope, and on-quality delivery of commercial software programs. These programs include both ongoing product upgrades as well as strategic investment initiatives. Create and maintain mandatory project artifacts (Project Plans, KPIs, Risk registers, prioritized backlogâ€¦). Run reviews and approvals in timely manner

Audit release plans for feasibility, clarity of expectations & assumptions and organization in DevOps; audit processes for quality of execution Coach program contributors, ensuring standards processes are upheld
Organize & facilitate SteCo, CCB, Gate and other mandatory governance meetings

Participate in PMO governance. Work with other program managers to implement common standards, perform peer review (gate assessments) and identify risks and opportunities across programs. Document and roll out latest processes update to the product line

C++ Software Engineer with Linux.about-project-1: About the projectAs a C++ Software Engineer you will be working on a development of solutions for highly interconnected automotive software features. In our projects, we are focusing on the design and development of middleware components for a Linux-based operating system in connected cars. We develop software that pulls all strings together, communicates with cloud services, and implements innovative customer functions inside the car. We work in areas of remote software update, telematics & connectivity, context-aware systems, and application platforms. We are committed to modern development methodologies and tools like continuous integration, agile development, and test automation to design and implement innovative and high-quality software. As part of our team, you will ensure robustness, performance, and security aspects within the software design.

Supervising and implementing the developed software concepts
Cooperating with other teams to follow up issues resolution as well as participating in strategic decisions together with the project management

As part of our software team you will be working on various charting applications in the aviation industry. Software Developer.employer-name: EUROFINS GSC IT POLAND Sp. z o.o.About the company
Software Developer.responsibilities-1: Your responsibilitiesSoftware developmentâ€¢ Develops information systems by designing, developing, and installing software solutions.â€¢ Develops technical specifications, determines operational feasibility of requirements.â€¢ Transforms software designs and specifications into functioning software, producing clean and efficient code.â€¢ Optimizes and maintains legacy systems, integrates software components and third-party programs.â€¢ Performs software upgrades and configurations to make software and systems more secure and efficient.â€¢ Improves operations and optimizes system efficiency by analysing performance indicators and recommending changes in policies and procedures.â€¢ Proactively investigates problem areas, recommends and executes improvements.â€¢ Automates tasks through appropriate tools and scripting.Testing, debuggingâ€¢ Troubleshoots development and production problems across multiple environments.â€¢ Resolves user-submitted problems and questions, fixes bugs in existing code.â€¢ Revises, updates, refactors and debugs existing code.â€¢ Designs, implements, and conducts tests to verify the proper operation of code.Documentationâ€¢ Develops and updates training and technical documentation, including flowcharts, diagrams, code comments and clear code, using company standards.â€¢ Demonstrates the developed solutions and features to users and colleagues.â€¢ Documents development and operational procedures.â€¢ Maintains project knowledge by documenting software changes and revisions.Training and supportâ€¢ Serves as an expert on the developed applications and provides training and technical support for users.â€¢ Supports junior developersâ€™ work.Collaboration, teamworkâ€¢ Actively participates in the procedures and ceremonies as prescribed by the development methodology.â€¢ Shares knowledge, maintains best practices within the development team and across teams.â€¢ Contributes to team meetings; collaborates with the team to determine and fine-tune development methodologies and toolsets.Personal accomplishmentsâ€¢ Maintains and updates professional knowledge by studying state-of-the-art development tools, programming techniques, and by participating in educational workshops, reading professional publications, and participating in professional societies.
Software Developer.requirements-1: Our requirementsEducation Background:â€¢ Educational background in computer science, software engineering or other relevant disciplineExperience:â€¢ Proven experience as a Software Developer, Software Engineer or similar role.â€¢ Understanding of Agile methodologies.â€¢ Understanding of object-oriented software engineering.â€¢ Knowledge of coding languages and frameworks/systems necessary for performing his tasks.â€¢ Working knowledge of databases (SQL), in-depth understanding of data management.Languages requirement:â€¢ Fluent English is a must.Personal profile:â€¢ Ability to write clean, well-documented code.â€¢ Ability to learn new languages and technologies.â€¢ Resourcefulness and troubleshooting attitude.â€¢ Analytical mind with problem-solving attitude.â€¢ Demonstrable ability to discover and fix errors in code.â€¢ Documentation skills.â€¢ Teamwork.â€¢ Attention to detail.â€¢ Ability to work independently.
Software Developer.requirements-expected-1: Education Background:â€¢ Educational background in computer science, software engineering or other relevant disciplineExperience:â€¢ Proven experience as a Software Developer, Software Engineer or similar role.â€¢ Understanding of Agile methodologies.â€¢ Understanding of object-oriented software engineering.â€¢ Knowledge of coding languages and frameworks/systems necessary for performing his tasks.â€¢ Working knowledge of databases (SQL), in-depth understanding of data management.Languages requirement:â€¢ Fluent English is a must.Personal profile:â€¢ Ability to write clean, well-documented code.â€¢ Ability to learn new languages and technologies.â€¢ Resourcefulness and troubleshooting attitude.â€¢ Analytical mind with problem-solving attitude.â€¢ Demonstrable ability to discover and fix errors in code.â€¢ Documentation skills.â€¢ Teamwork.â€¢ Attention to detail.â€¢ Ability to work independently.

Software Developer.additional-module-1: Job overviewThe Software Developer is responsible, as part of the development team, to accomplish the necessary technical activities (e.g. analysis, technical documentation, development, testing, etc.) that are required to build and implement software. The task of the Software Developer is to participate in the entire software development life cycle, developing, testing, improving and maintaining new and existing software, deploying and configuring the created applications.

Java EE Developer.about-project-1: About the projectWe are looking for a Java Developer to join our Team as a member of the remote development team of a new information system for a logistics company using the Java EE technologies stack. Your main task will be the development of a web - based application to support shipping company businesses all over the world.
responsibilities-1: Building application architecture by using Clean Architecture and Domain Driven Design approach.
Following Clean Code principles.
Performing data access by using the JPA.
Being involved in the QA process: CodeReview, Static Code Analysis, and all layers test coverage (unit, service, and e2e).
Using BDD/Gherkin pattern tests (Given-When-Then) and JUnit, AssertJ, Mockito, and DbUnit frameworks.
Working with CI/CD process based on GitLab and Jenkins.
Mostly working on backend development.
Participating in team meetings.
Short-term business trips to Germany.
requirements-1: Minimum 2 years of professional experience in Java EE.
Spoken English - intermediate or higher.
requirements-expected-1: Minimum 2 years of professional experience in Java EE.
Spoken English - intermediate or higher.
requirements-optional-1: Experience using Java 8 (Lambda, Stream, Optional, etc.).
Experience in JPA using Hibernate or other ORM frameworks.
Knowledge of IoC (Inversion of control programming principle).
Knowledge of JUnit, AssertJ, Mockito, and DbUnit.

Small units called squads are the core of our organization. Software Engineer (Java).responsibilities-1: Your responsibilitiesIn this role, Software Engineer will work as part of the existing delivery team responsible for developing new projects. As a team member will be responsible for developing OTA applications together with tech team leader, server developers, client developers, DevOps team and quality assurance team. It will require to participate in requirements analysis, development and maintenance, so full project lifecycle. 85% of time will be dedicated to developing new features, 15% of time for support activities. Main development is for new microservices written in Java11-17, Kotlin or Scala (JVM languages in general) with highly covered code by tests and a well documentation. The deployment target is Kubernetes. The methodology is so agile that it is not a clear agile anymore â€“ kind of a variation of Scrum and Kanban which could be called Scrumban.

Software Tester.employer-name: REYNAERS ALUMINIUM SP. Z O.OAbout the company
responsibilities-1: Your goal is to discover errors and bugs in the software. You support colleague software test engineers and functional analysts in testing software and building and maintaining the necessary test environments.

You elaborate tests and create new test specifications, basing yourself on standard protocols/scripts. You further coordinate these test specifications with the functional analysts so that the tests optimally cover the functionalities to be tested.
You help plan and organise the tests in cooperation with functional analysts and suppliers.
You ensure the long-term structure of the existing test plans.

You analyse the test results. Where possible, you initially try to solve the problems yourself, or find out their cause. You report and discuss the results obtained with the test engineers and functional analysts.

You help with knowledge transfer when the software is sufficiently stable to be introduced to market: you document the roll-out procedures for the support colleagues and develop manuals for them or for our customers. You look for the most efficient way to transfer knowledge and prepare this (e.g. by making 'How to'-films, preparing and -if interested- giving knowledge transfer sessions,...).
Place of work Piaseczno, - from Q3 - Q4 2023 target place of work Przeszkoda - Å»abia Wola
requirements-1: You have a higher degree in an ICT or technical field.
You have a first experience in software development or as a tester, and have knowledge of C#, Javascript and/or C++. ISTQB certification is a plus.
Knowledge of XML, SQL or BDD is a plus, as is experience with Autodesk Revit
Knowledge of structured testing methods and techniques is a plus.
You are analytically strong and able to quickly interpret data.
You speak English fluently as you will be working in an international context.
As a real team player, you work closely with your colleagues and are flexible.

Senior UI Developer with React.additional-module-1: Description:We work primarily with big enterprise companies, helping them to replatform their client-facing web applications to the modern technological stack, or build web applications for internal use. In most cases we work with modern frameworks and tools, like Angular or ReactJS. We also use NodeJS to build back-end for the front-end. In addition, we do performance optimization and architecture assessment. Solutions we use are based on strong engineering practices, and our company follows the best DevOps and automation practices.You can get a unique experience working with a complex customerâ€™s infrastructure and dealing with a high number of integrations with external systems, as these require strong architectural design skills.Your mission will be challenging but interesting: to develop a sophisticated end-to-end system, and drive adoption of modern methodologies like Scrum, TDD, and Continuous Integration within the team.If you are excited about all aspects of modern engineering - writing great code, creating architectures, designing components, interacting with clients, and delivering the working system to production - then you are the kind of person we are looking for. If you enjoy freedom and responsibility, creative thinking, leading, and mentoring others, come join our team of world-class developers, QA engineers, DevOps engineers, architects, and managers.

Supply Operations Developer.employer-name: IKEA Purchasing Services Poland Sp. z o.o.About the company
Supply Operations Developer.publication-dates: offer expired over a month ago
responsibilities-1: You secure logistical operational performance from end-to-end perspective as it is defined by respective set of KPIs/PIs.
You align actions with supply chain actors to secure smooth and efficient logistics
You follow-up on the compliance of a given stakeholders and secure the execution of relevant plans.
You validate and optimise sending and receiving capabilities.
You act upon fluctuations to avoid performance disruptions and increased total cost.
You propose new logistical set-ups to support long term cost development.
You secure right information on constraints and availability impact to supply chain stakeholders.
requirements-1: You have an university degree in logistics, economics or other relevant background and worked at least 1-2 years with logistics/supply chain processes.
You have experience in implementation of decided concepts, working methods and tools.
You have the capability to build fact-based business cases in close cooperation with relevant stakeholders and find win-win-solutions within the supply chain.
You have good presentation and communication skills and the capability of building effective and trustful relationships
you have good organizational skills in order to prioritize tasks and maximize the efficiency.
You always strive to reach goals with a high level of energy and motivation and are confident to make independent decisions.
You enjoy interacting with many different people and networks and always have the customer and cost in focus.
You are fluent in English.

Supply Operations Developer.additional-module-3: About the assignmentYou secure excellence in total Supply Chain operational performance and its further development, in close cooperation and alignment with all relevant supply chain stakeholders. You contribute to reach customer perceived availability at the lowest total cost (considering impacts of quality, safety, service performance, sustainability and other supply chain costs securing optimal replenishment solution).You will be member of a team where sharing and learning together is a very important part of developing the business. You will have the possibility to establish and widen your personal networks. You can grow your experience as well as gaining a broader knowledge of IKEA supply chain.
Supply Operations Developer.additional-module-5: Sounds interesting?Submit your application as soon as possible however not later than April 7th 2023. Please note that we will be interviewing continuously, which means that we may close the application process earlier than stated if we find the right candidate.We look forward to receive your application, in English!

Embedded Software Component Analyst.about-project-1: About the projectThe person in the given job position is going to be involved in the development of embedded software deployed further onto ECUs (Electronic Control Units). The ECUs play a number of roles in controlling of HVAC systems (gas boilers, heat pumps, ventilation and energy management systems).Our SW development teams design and provide implementation of the essential features available in the Viessmann ecosystem. The solutions and components we develop affect not only the operational scope of the HVAC system but also directly influence the customers experience, a number of connected accessories, and digital services like: cloud solutions, extension modules, user frontends (local, web and mobile). We are at the heart of it! This operation scope translates to the constant interaction with many stakeholders interested in the final shape of the solutions supporting the entire product lines.
responsibilities-1: preparation and maintenance of software specifications for developed ECUs - variants, scope changes tracking and management,
moderation over the proper requirements life cycle processing - from a initial version, through reviews, up to final approvals,
ensuring the quality of the documented requirements and traceability with the productâ€™s higher-level specifications,
documenting the functional logic of the data interface used to exchange the information between the components interconnected in the system,

close cooperation with projectâ€™s key players, like product owner, requirements engineers responsible for delivery of the higher-level requirements, development teams, and architects to understand the details of implementations,
supporting the definition of the development teamâ€™s backlog and sprint planning,
sharing the knowledge on the system's functionality with other teams in the development process,
sharing the requirements engineering knowledge and good practices with other colleagues within the organisation and reporting cyclically on the requirements completion and processing states.
requirements-1: experience in the Research and Development field, preferable in the area of embedded SW,
experience and knowledge in the area of requirements management and documentation, preparation and maintenance of software specifications for developed products,
acquainted with software management and requirement engineering toolchain (e.g. Jira, Confluence, Polarion, DOORS, etc.),
good skills in communication and presentation,
experience in elicitation methods for communication with stakeholders out of technical and business environments,
experience in modelling techniques (e.g. UML, sysML, BPMN or similar),
knowledge of SW development lifecycle,
problem-solving engineering mindset,
fluent in written and spoken English.
requirements-expected-1: experience in the Research and Development field, preferable in the area of embedded SW,
experience and knowledge in the area of requirements management and documentation, preparation and maintenance of software specifications for developed products,
acquainted with software management and requirement engineering toolchain (e.g. Jira, Confluence, Polarion, DOORS, etc.),
good skills in communication and presentation,
experience in elicitation methods for communication with stakeholders out of technical and business environments,
experience in modelling techniques (e.g. UML, sysML, BPMN or similar),
knowledge of SW development lifecycle,
problem-solving engineering mindset,
fluent in written and spoken English.
requirements-optional-1: engineering degree preferably in the field of electronics, telecommunication, physics or similar,
work practice at the embedded systems electronics development or telecommunication, automotive, HVAC systems, white goods or similar,
german language skill at any level,
understanding of basic SW programming concepts and principles.

.NET Developer.about-project-1: About the projectAs a Mid .NET Developer you will be responsible for creating new functionalities (80%) and maintaining existing live solutions (20%). From that role we expect a solid knowledge and experience in creating backend .net services.The Team has solid eCommerce experience, previously working on B2C eCommerce platform.Currently, we are at the head of creating services and tools around the new eCommerce engine using Azure cloud (Azure Dev/Ops, AKS, SQ, etc.). Our main focus is to create a generic tool for product branding that can be applied in different eCommerce solutions. As a Team we are strongly aiming to provide clean, tested, self explained code. We are using best practices and commonly known tools. We are eager to experiment to find best solutions.Come join us, help us and evolve!

Frontend Developer.employer-name: SILVAIR SP. Z O.O.About the company
Frontend Developer.about-project-1: About the projectThis is a role within a team whose main goal is to develop the most important Silvair product - its Silvair Platform consisting of backend and Web Application which is using technologies/tools like: Angular 13+, Angular Material, RxJS, Protractor, JWT, WebSocket, RabbitMQ, AWS, Terraform.As our ecosystem grows, the number of the new IoT devices connected to it constantly increases, translating to the growing traffic to process - automatic scalability and performance become one of the challenges we are focusing on. You will help us develop solutions that meet the challenge of growing traffic on Silvair Services (hundreds of thousand nodes) and developing new features enriching the Silvair solution with additional functionalities and making it the best Lighting System on the market.You will join an experienced team and be able to learn a lot from your colleagues not only within your team but also from the rest of the organization. To boost your efficiency and creativity, we will give you freedom to choose your tools and let you propose the way of implementing things.As our platform is fully integrated with the cloud computing environment using virtualization containers, the job will offer many opportunities to learn technologies such as Docker and AWS. We also believe that high-quality code is the only way to get a great final product, so we are investing our time into Continuous Integration with unit testing and static code analysis tools.

Senior Android Developer.about-project-1: About the projectYou will join the organization that built smart lock devices from scratch and is now ready to be one of the biggest producers of such devices in Europe.As Android developer, you will join the Mobile team and be responsible for extend and improve our main native mobile application for Android and Wear OS. The app allows user to setup, control and manage his Tedee smart device and is core component of our product. Together with your team you will be responsible for continuously improving the app to use latest technologies and be up to date with market, adopt the apps to latest Android operating system and features. You will work together with mobile, backend and embedded teams in SCRUM to plan your work, design features, implement and test them and then release the increment every 2 weeks.If you want to focus on single product, work with users community, work with us to be a leader as smart lock brand you are in good place.Be smart choose Tedee!
responsibilities-1: Your main responsibility will be to extend our main mobile and watch application by implementing new features based on requirements and prepared UX designs. To achieve that you will work with the backend and embedded teams
Refactor app to keep it up to date with latest technologies

Work together with our support team to satisfy our users
Releasing new app versions
Analyze collected data to improve our product

Senior Java Developer.about-project-1: About the projectYou will join the Mortgage program where we work on delivering state of the art solutions for the customers in Denmark. Our main task is to work on a big project in the Mortgage area, where we build a solution for about 20 different banks in Denmark. The project is interesting and challenging because it in-volves many different components and technologies. It is a scaled project, with 4 teams in BEC and about 9 teams in Nykredit working on it. As a developer you will have a chance to work with different aspects of the project, from design and refinement, through development, up to code review and deployment. You will also have a chance to work with different technologies like Java 11, Rest APIs, Angular 12, Camunda, Kafka, OpenShift, K8s, SonarQube etc. As a team architect, you will have a chance to dig deeper into the business processes and have a good understanding of how the system works. Later you will use this knowledge to help the team to design, plan and implement the upcoming fea-tures. We expect to spend up to 20% of your time as an architect and the rest on the development.

responsibilities-1: Conduct data analysis using Python/R (statistical tool) and VBA pertaining to ALM balance sheet models

Document underlying methodologies, design, assumptions and operating models

Ability to independently and efficiently execute on assigned tasks
Excellent written and verbal communication in English.

Senior Power BI Developer.about-project-1: About the projectEvery IT solution is based on data, therefore the area of data management is key for all IT projects. The DATA Department at PwC IT Services is a group of specialists with deep understanding of business needs of our customers allowing the solutions we design to fully meet the expectations of all users.We design Data Warehouses, configure Reporting Systems, plan and execute Data Migration processes for companies from various industry sectors.Our engineers take care of Data Quality, optimize SQL and procedural code regardless of the technology and define flows in ETL/ELT processesAnalysts and Data Architects develop an enterprise-wide approach to data and data related issues.
responsibilities-1: Participate in Data Analytics Platforms delivery for customers from variety of industries,
Work with customers to understand their needs, present and discuss results of your work e.g. reports prototypes, proposed data visualisations, final reports & dashboards etc.

Analyse data sources, integrate data, identify gaps and inconsistencies in data,
Analyse and design of data models,
Support design and implementation of data ingestions processes,
Share your knowledge with less experienced teammates,
Contribute to standards and delivery guidelines used in our Data Practice.

Lead Software Engineer (React, Java 11).about-project-1: About the projectSmart Shield is a novel, patent pending greenfield SaaS security product that performs data masking for Workday.We launched our first product, Smart Test, in 2014 and have experienced considerable growth - we are continually evolving and expanding our product suite with a keen customer focus. Since then, we have gone to market with 3 additional products - Smart Audit, Smart Shield and most recently, Employee Document Management.You will be using technologies such as React, Java 11 (Spring Boot, Cloud Gateway) and Keycloak on AWS. You will work within a small, collaborative team comprised of developers, architects, product owners, automated testers and designers.You will also work with our product team to help build out our customer-focused roadmaps. Through proof of concepts, assumption tests and technical designs, you will design solutions that challenge the problems faced by our customers and prospects.This is an excellent opportunity to make a real impact on an early stage SaaS security product at an innovative and customer-focused (customer satisfaction scores = 98%) company.

Youâ€™ll do this whilst learning about new technologies and approaches, with talented colleagues that will help you to learn, develop and grow as you, in turn, mentor those around you.As a Lead Software Engineer (Consultant) in Kainos, youâ€™ll be responsible for leading teams and developing high quality solutions which delight our customers and impact the lives of users worldwide. Itâ€™s a fast-paced environment so it is important for you to make sound, reasoned decisions. Youâ€™ll do this whilst learning about new technologies and approaches, with talented colleagues that will help you to learn, develop and grow. Youâ€™ll manage, coach and develop a small number of staff, with a focus on managing employee performance and assisting in their career development. Youâ€™ll also provide direction and leadership for your team as you solve challenging problems together. As the technical leader in the team, you will also interact with customers, share knowledge and mentor those around you.

additional-module-2: Our technology stack is:
backend services: Kotlin or Java (11 or newer) using Spring
frontend: React or Angular
we store the data in: MongoDB, Cassandra, Couchbase, Elasticsearch
we process data using: Spark, Jupyter, Hadoop, GCP
We operate on a large scale:
architecture composed of over 1 000 microservices divided into domains
communication asynchronously over the Hermes data bus based on Kafka (100 000 rps of incoming traffic)
traffic between services, measured by Service Mesh, is almost 2 million rps

The IT team is made up of over 1 700 members who have shared their knowledge at multiple conferences, such as DevDays, Geekon, Code Europe, Perspektywy Women In Tech Summit, Devoxx, Confitura, and co-create a blog: allegro.tech
Microservices â€“ a few thousand microservices and 1.8m+ rps on our business data bus
Big Data â€“ several petabytes of data and Machine Learning used in production
We practice Code Review, Continuous Integration, Scrum/Kanban, Domain Driven Design, Test Driven Development, Pair Programming, depending on the team

Our internal ecosystem is based on self-service and widely used tools, such as Kubernetes, Docker, Consul, GitHub or GitHub Actions. This will allow you, from day one, to develop software using any language, architecture and scale, restricted only by your creativity and imagination.

To match the scale, we also focus on building entire Platforms of tools and technologies that accelerate and facilitate day-to-day development, and we ensure the best Developer Experience to our teams
Technological autonomy: you get to choose which technology solves the problem at hand (no need for managementâ€™s consent). You are responsible for what you create
Our deployment environment combines private Data Centers (tens of thousands of servers) and Public Clouds (Google Cloud and Microsoft Azure)
Over 100 original open source projects and a few thousand stars on github

We organize Allegro Tech Live event, a 100% remote version of our offline Allegro Tech Talks meetups, and we make guest appearances at the invitation of such communities as Warsaw AI, JUG (PoznaÅ„, ÅÃ³dÅº, Lublin, WrocÅ‚aw), WG .Net, Dare IT, Women in Tech Summit

We focus on development as well. We organize hackathons and internal conferences (e.g. the annual Allegro Tech Meeting), our employees regularly participate in events both in Poland and abroad (Europe and USA), and each team has its own budget for training and study aids. If you want to keep growing and share your knowledge, we will always support you

Senior Software Developer.about-project-1: About the project1. We Helped build ABRP (using React Native and Expo), a route planner for EV drivers used by thousands of people worldwide. We are now part of the ABRP team; we work on new features for users and improve the app. We also help the engineering team to ship the updates quicker.2. We built Up&Up's user-facing mobile app and worked on SSR to improve their web app's performance and SEO. Besides that, we solved management and scalability problems by introducing monorepo and Kubernetes for Up&Up. These changes helped the Up&Up engineering team shorten the development cycle (faster feature-building and bug-fixing). It also allowed new team members to onboard quicker. It improved the overall feeling and performance of apps for Up&Up's users.3. We created an infrastructure (using Elixir and ReScript) that helped Walnut's R&D team quickly add new integrations with third-party services like Salesforce or Hubspot. Walnut's customers can now easily integrate their software with Walnut and see how their Demos are used.These are examples of what we are known for.At Product Brew:â€¢	As a Senior Software Developer, you'll help our partners develop their own products.â€¢	You'll have an opportunity to collaborate with international teams because our partners are mainly from the U.S., UK, Europe, and Israel. We also support Polish businesses ğŸ‡µğŸ‡± â¤ï¸â€¢	We are self-funded - no one says how and with whom we should work. Don't worry, though; we're far from working on maximising profits.

Senior Front-end Developer.about-project-1: About the projectAre you looking for new challenges with a purpose? What about working with a healthcare institution to help refine its medical research portal?We are now looking for an experienced senior front-end developer to join our team and help refine the existing web portal by developing new features and introducing improvements using the best software development practices. If you have at least three years of in-depth experience with JavaScript, this could be the right opportunity for you.About the projectThe project we are working on consists of a web-based application with over 10,000 current users; It is developed for the entire research community to review, monitor, and manage research portfolios. The main goal of the project is to unite distributed and complex organizational processes into one application and help alleviate administrative burdens.Team: 20 back-end engineers, 4 front-end engineers, 4 DBAs, 1 UX designer, 8 QA/BA, and 1 PM.PROJECT TECH-STACK: REACT.JS, REDUX, SASS, WORDPRESS

Additionally, we support a number of sports sections, and, you can even join our yoga team in the summer to practice yoga on the roof!Let&s be balanced â€“ Work-life balance is essential for us. That's why we offer our employees flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working. However, it won't be easy to stay at home with our in-office gaming room.Let&s be smart - Staying up-to-date with all the new systems and technologies is not an easy task. That's why we have an extensive training and workshops offer, both in-house and with external providers. We organize hackathons and meetups, which are an excellent opportunity for our specialists to showcase their expertise. On top of that, we offer digital learning platforms, language courses, and a library.Let&s be responsible - We love to see the difference we make together with our CSR projects. That's why we are always open to new projects, and we would love to include you in our next charity event!Let&s be fun - At ET&S we love not only to work but also relax together. Sports events like company-wide bike race, or maybe a film marathon in our cinema room? Don't worry; we got it covered! Maybe you have a passion and would love to make an event out of it? Sure! We will help you!Let&s be diverse - At ET&S we create a working environment free of prejudice and exclusion. Each member of our team can experience being valued, regardless of his or her gender, nationality, religious beliefs, disabilities, age, and sexual orientation or identity. Your wide range of qualifications, experiences, and ways of thinking are of great benefit to us!

PHP Backend Engineer.about-project-1: About the projectWe are Clinics Delight - we provide patients with access to the best doctors and clinics around the world. We are looking for an experienced Software Engineer with solid PHP/ Symfony background to contribute to this goal!People: our team right now is 20 people â€” not only Software Engineers but the whole team responsible for product development. We all wear many hats and have a say in the final product. If you like working in an early-stage environment, this is something for you.Product: in our team we are focused on delivering bookings to our customers (both doctors and clinics), helping them to promote their practices and we are helping patients to find the best healthcare support that fits them best. we're building a mediator for an internet telephony system, so not yet another CRUD app. We might not be blockchain-based, but we operate at the junction of healthcare, user experience, and marketing. We found our initial market fit and are now in the growth phase with hundreds of thousands of clients across five markets.Technology: we have a lot of freedom and use it to manage the technical debt level. This means PHPUnit tests, PHPStan level 8, code sniffer, deptrac, and more. While some areas we'd like to pay closer attention to and refactor continuously. We work with our legacy code as well as with new projects. Right now we are designing distributed architecture for one of our core features.

Your focus will be backend development (you will have the opportunity to work with others on topics in your area of interest)
We expect you to bring in some innovative ideas to the team â€” you will not always be told what to do next.

Your salary will be, now and always, 100% transparent to youShare options plan after 6 months of working with us.Remote or hybrid work model with or hub in Warsaw;Flexible working hours (fully flexible, as in most cases you only have to be on a couple of meetings weekly);21/26 days of paid time off (depending on your contract);Additional paid day off on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).Private healthcare plan with Signal Iduna for you and subsidized for your family.Multisport card co-financing for you to have access to sports facilities across Poland.Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.20% time rule: spend 20% of your working hours on your own growth;Free English classes.
recruitment-stages-1: 130 min screen with Talent Acquisition Partner
21h meeting with Hiring Manager and T.A. Partner
43h meeting to discuss the solution, get to know the team
additional-module-1: We're working with Symfony 2.8 / 4.4 PHP 7.4.
We use some of the following services and more: MariaDB, PostgreSQL, Algolia, ElasticSearch/OpenSearch, RabbitMQ, Redis, Varnish (cache), GitHub & GH Actions and NewRelic as an observability tool.
The backend is mostly monolithic system above 1M LOC but we deliver all new features within dedicated / isolated modules.
We're following DDD principles, but we're not fanatical about it.
We benefit from continuous delivery â€” we deploy as soon as the code review is complete, and it's all automated.
We're splitting up our monolithic codebase into distributed architecture. It is an ongoing process, but there's much to be done.
Tables, indexes and query optimizations, pre-calculating data, you name it - the traffic increases, so we're starting to face non-trivial performance issues.
additional-module-2: At Docplanner Tech we are a diverse group of over 400 people working in Engineering, Data, and Product teams. We are responsible for building the product for all locations. Many of us have been here for over 5 years, yet we still welcome each new person with great joy and excitement.
We could tell you about us, but we will let our reviews on Glassdoor speak for themselves.
PHP Backend Engineer.additional-module-3: Because it feels good to tell your family and your friends how you made the world a little bit better. You go to bed knowing that what you do matters, and that your talents align with your beliefs.We want to make the healthcare experience more human, and that starts with you being you. We believe that taking the diversity of human experience into account makes a better healthcare experience for all . Weâ€™re not just different: we embrace diversity. We will encourage you to come to work your whole self, and that includes not coming to the office at all if you prefer not to, as we're 100% remote friendly.We are leaders in 13 countries so far, and more than 80 million patients trust us every month. 130.000 specialists believe in us and our product, and so do leading venture capital funds such as Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Asset Management and One Peak Partners. And yet, employing over 2.500 people all over the globe, we managed to keep the startup-mindset we started with over 10 years ago.

Junior Flutter Developer.about-project-1: About the projectProject description:The hired person will be responsible for developing new features for several applications in a long-term project. The project involves managing and monitoring real-time collection from suppliers. The work will primarily involve developing new features, with 90% of the time dedicated to this task, while the remaining 10% will be for maintenance and deployment.Project duration:The project is long-term, and the team is currently in the phase of adding new features to the existing system.Team:The project team consists of four developers. Two senior developers, one mid-level developer, and two junior developers. The team will collaborate with other roles, including a PM, front-end developer, and full-stack developer.
responsibilities-1: We are looking for ambitious and team-oriented individuals keen on shaping the future and gaining experience in developing business solutions. You will be a key player in the development cycle from the design through the implementation and release up to the maintenance.

React Developer.about-project-1: About the projectPAYBACK GROUP as a part of American Express Group is a pioneer and technology leader in Loyalty Solutions.PAYBACK GROUP offers two types of platforms:Â the biggest in Europe multiparter loyalty platform called PAYBACK as well as the customer-tailored, monopartnerÂ  Loyalty Management Suite (LMS). In-house development, delivery and maintenance of the powerful LMS software belongs to Partner Solutions GmbH (LPS). From consulting to program strategy, customization and data migration, as well as the integration of the software into the customers' ecosystems, LPS offers all services from a single source. LMS solution is used by companies such as Lufthansa, United Airlines, Deutsche Bahn AG and China Southern Airlines.
responsibilities-1: Develop appealing, modern, responsive, performant frontends for our loyalty platform in the airline market.

Improve our loyalty platform.by challenging the status quo and bring in your ideas.
Drive technology innovations to enable business innovations based on our platform.
Be part of an agile cross functional team to shape the loyalty platform solution for the next generation.

Software Developer Intern - (More than j.about-project-1: About the projectHi! Weâ€™re u2i - a tech company comprising ~65 problem-solvers with diverse skill sets in back end, front end, full stack, mobile, and UX design. And weâ€™re on the lookout for Software Developer Interns to join our teams in creating great products, hand in hand with our US-based Clients.But most importantly, we hope to find a true colleague and friend whoâ€™ll enjoy facing everyday challenges, striving for technical excellence, and growing together. Weâ€™re seeking a partner whoâ€™s in for the long haul, not afraid to experience all the shapes and sizes of software development, and excited to master an array of skills needed to become a great professional and grow as a person. Sounds interesting? If so, keep reading.Dates: July 4th - Sept 30th, 2023 (with the possibility to continue working together later on)Full-time* with 10 days of paid holidays*Should we prolong our cooperation, weâ€™ll make sure you have all the flexibility of a part-time, hybrid work model to continue your studies or other engagements, and will be granted all perks available to u2iâ€™ers.
responsibilities-1: As a Software Developer Intern @u2i, you will:
join a 2-6 people team working directly with one of our Clients on a daily basis and experience all the flavors of a fully-fledged project from day 1,
learn how to develop great code, think creatively about a solution, and acquire consulting skills supported by your team members every step of the way,

have a real influence on what we build and how we build it, and contribute to the growth of a high-performing quality-focused team, which relies on trust, shared responsibility, and self-organization,

learn how to match the best tools for solving problems, and not the other way around - our stack varies from project to project, but you can definitely expect to come across some of the most popular technologies @u2i like: Ruby, Ruby on Rails, React, React Native, Python, AWS, MySQL, PostgreSQL,

make a tangible difference in people's lives by contributing to either of several EdTech or MedTech projects, or perhaps become part of the unwavering success of a Big Data product around social media platforms and measurement. Hereâ€™s an overview of our ongoing projects - https://www.u2i.com/u2i_Discover_Our_Projects.pdf

Software Developer Intern - (More than j.additional-module-3: What does the recruitment process look like?1. Applications close on Apr 3rd. Weâ€™d love to get to know you a bit better so please, read the application form carefully and provide us with honest answers. There is no need to send us your CV!2. Shortly after the applications close, weâ€™ll invite you to the next stage of the recruitment process which consists of a few programming tasks and one open-ended question to be answered in a short video(this will help us check your English skills, and learn more about your expectations towards the Internships). Youâ€™ll have a few days to send us both the completed tasks and the video answer. You can be sure that youâ€™ll hear back from us by the middle of April.3. BONUS (non-evaluation stage): On April 13th weâ€™ll hold a special event for top applicants! Itâ€™ll be an afternoon filled with lots of fun, for you to get a better taste of u2iâ€™s vibes and culture, and chat with your potential fellow colleagues :)4. The final stage of the process will be a ~1,5h interview at our office, where youâ€™ll have the chance to truly show off your skills. It will be held by 2 Developers and our Recruitment Devil. Itâ€™ll take place in the second half of April, and youâ€™ll receive the final decision by the end of April.5. Regardless of our decision, weâ€™ll make sure that you receive timely feedback during each stage of the process. If it turns out that we're a great match for each other, then welcome to u2i! We canâ€™t wait to start your onboarding shortly :)If you feel the chemistry already just hit â€applyâ€ and letâ€™s give it a go!

Learn to deliver projects from definition, through build and testing, up to shipping to production

Internship - FPGA developer.employer-name: Hitachi Energy Poland Sp. z o.o.About the company
Internship - FPGA developer.publication-dates: offer expired over a month ago
Internship - FPGA developer.about-project-1: About the projectOur R&D engineers and scientists develop breakthrough technologies that change the way the world works, and industries do business. We constantly push the limits of convention, while retaining our focus on delivering quality products and solutions to our customers.Over 60 years ago, Hitachi Energy introduced a new way of transmitting electricity across long distances with minimum losses â€“ High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC). You will contribute to successful results in the heart of HVDC station: Modular Advanced Control for HVDC (MACHâ„¢). R&D development in Krakow is focused among DSP (digital signal processor) units, I/O systems and Power Electronics valve control units. FPGA development is done on chips delivered by Xilinx and Lattice.Reporting to Mateusz Guzik, you will utilize your knowledge and skills in technology and/or product development to identify and implement innovative solutions.
responsibilities-1: Support in development of next generation HVDC control and protection system based on FPGA modules from world class vendors.
Development, simulation and validation mainly using VHDL + ModelSim.
Preparing and managing technical documentation.
Participation in prototyping and testing on real hardware in modern laboratories.
Cooperation with specialists from international teams.
Learning and developing your skills to understand technical know-how.
requirements-1: You are a 2nd â€“ 5th year student with a preferred programming/control engineering/electronics background (programming, automation, mechatronics, electronics, power electronics or related field).
You are familiar with FPGA/ASIC designs in VHDL and/or Verilog, basic understanding of synchronous design, time constraining and design simulations is a plus.
You have basic experience with laboratory equipment, prototyping and testing.
You can effectively communicate in English (B2+).
You are strongly committed to safe work practices and to following all relevant workplace safety guidelines.
You are self-motivated, curious and eager to learn about new technologies.
You have a collaborative, solutions-oriented approach and strong communication skills.
Basic knowledge of Python is a plus.
Availability at least 20 hours a week.

responsibilities-1: Engineering associated with the manufacturing process. Accountable for the quality of own work. Subject to direct operations supervision/prescribed work instructions/systems checking. Executes within a well-defined operations framework. There is generally a step by step sequence of standard operational tasks which need to be followed to achieve an end result.
Define and control production process including tooling and equipment. Validate design specifications and shop floor application of new product, tools, or equipment. Includes Manufacturing Engineers.

A job at this level requires a people leader with ability to hire and develop talent. Includes direct people management responsibility including staffing and performance development. Utilizes in-depth knowledge of a technical discipline and analytical thinking and technical experience to execute policy/strategy.
Has knowledge of best practices and how own area integrates with others; is aware of the competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market

Uses some judgment and has some ability to propose different solutions outside of set parameters to address more complicated manufacturing processes with technical variety and/or interdependent production cycles. Uses technical experience and analytical thinking. Uses multiple internal and limited external sources outside of own teams to arrive at decisions.

Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. May lead small projects with low risks and resource requirements. Explains information; developing skills to bring team members to consensus around topics within field. Conveys performance expectations and may handle sensitive issues.
requirements-1: Master degree in Manufacturing Engineering or familiar faculties.
Very good knowledge of SINUMERIC, FANUC or/and additional CNC software.
Very good knowledge of GD&T.
Knowledge of CMM environment and basic experience in automation of production processes.
Experience in grinding, EDM and milling techniques with understanding of basic parameters and process behavior.
Understanding of validation process together with dedicated tools and software.
Experience with preparation of technical documentation with good knowledge of technical drawings and design rules.
Desired Characteristics
Basic knowledge of CAD software specially NX with ability for design and draft of dedicated tooling based on product documentation.
Basic knowledge of WGM software for production routers preparation.
Good knowledge of LEAN tools and six sigma for problem solving approaches.
Experience in grinding, EDM and milling techniques with understanding of basic parameters and process behavior.
Strong oral and written communication skills. Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems. Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs. Established project management skills.

Wind Project Developer.additional-module-1: About the roleWe are looking for a Project Developer who will be responsible for utility scale wind and solar project development. They will focus on securing land, site assessments, measuring campaigns, municipal licensing, environmental procedures, connection to the grid, coordination of design and authorisation and obtaining building permissions. Providing due diligence review of project development and construction related contracts, technical documents, and field work will also be part of this role. Growing together with the project lifecycle managing and searching for subcontractors and service providers and cooperating with external consultants and co-developers will be a significant part of the role.
Wind Project Developer.additional-module-2: Diversity, inclusion & privacyCero Generation understands the importance of diversity and inclusion. We value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you are capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.Cero Generation is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, gender identity, marriage, civil partnership, pregnancy, maternity, race (including colour and ethnic or national origins), religion or belief. We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.Cero Generation respects the privacy of the people we deal with and we uphold high standards of privacy practice and security. Our privacy policy is available on our website at cerogeneration.com

Java Developer - Talent Pool.about-project-1: About the projectNot looking for a job but want to have a plan B? Join Boldare Talent Pool process! If you pass it successfully and an open position appears, you will be the first person to whom we make an offer.Besides having a priority to receive a job offer, by joining our Talent Pool, you will reach the benefits:â€¢ Get to know what's going on in the labor market. Learn what kind of questions recruiters are asking now and get some tips on how to prepare a resume to be attractive to employers.â€¢ Check your seniority level. Will we assume it is the same as in your current company? Talk about hot topics, learn new tips, and get valuable know-how.â€¢ Is something bothering you at your current job? Check how it would be different at Boldare! Find out what it's like to work here.

you will participate in design discussions and help others through code reviews and knowledge sharing.
you will help elevate the programming skills of the team through technical mentorship.
you will work with the design team to create user-interfaces that are easy to comprehend, performant and reliable using modern tools like React, Jest and Webpack.

Software Tester.about-project-1: About the projectInternational Software Development Team for Leading 3d Metrology Software.We are a Software R&D Center in ZEISS. We are leading the development of software for the world class inspection machines based on vision sensors and imageprocessing technologies. Our aspiration is to develop best-in-class software for our customers to highly efficiently process data from 2D and 3D sensors used inmetrology, quality control and reverse engineering.

You will be involved in the testing current developments and part of the development team

C/Python Developer.about-project-1: About the projectIn a day to day work we work with number of programming languages: C/C++/Python/Java/Fortran, we create scripts for the process automation: bash/tch, we work on container based solutions (Docker/docker-compose) to make it possible to run simulation in virtually any environment.For a new project, run under EUROfusion consortium, we are looking for people with the experience in one of the mentioned languagess.
responsibilities-1: One of the integral part of our job is a constant development. We are looking for open minded people who are eager to learn new things on a daily basis. Research and development is an integral part of our day to day work.
We are looking for people who graduated either from physics (with solid computer science background) or computer science. We are open for working with studens.

Familiar with at least one of the programming languages: Java, C, C++, Fortran, Python
Familiar with CLI based work environment (bash/tcsh)
Know how of debugging applications at high performance clusters
Open minded approach when it comes to dealing with number of various technology stacks
Eager to learn and extend knowledge on daily basis
Familiar with script based development (Bash/Python)
Experience with GCC/Intel is a plus
Familiar with various build systems (Ant, Maven, GNU Make, CMake, EasyBuild)
Familiar with GNU Emacs/VIM
English is a must - we cooperate with people across the whole Europe

Senior Backend Software Engineer (Rust).publication-dates: offer expired over a month ago
Senior Backend Software Engineer (Rust).about-project-1: About the projectWe're currently looking for a Senior Backend Software Engineer to join our Core Team.This team is building the backbone of the Golem Network, a highly complex and, in our opinion, quite enjoyable system. The main component is yagna, written purely in Rust. It is an entry point to Golem like, e.g., geth or erigon are entry points to the Ethereum network. The team consists of above-average skilled engineers solving complex problems in the decentralized systems area.You would have much space for your ideas and research, doing innovations to improve yagna, our runtimes (QEMU-based light VM), networking, scalability, reputation, security, and many other pieces that are at the core of the Golem Network. In many aspects, we tackle unique problems that no one has done before, which makes this role challenging and exciting.Golem Factory Tech Stack:â€¢	Backend: Rust, Python 3.8+, JavaScript (Node.js), TypeScript, RESTâ€¢	Version control, Reviews, Issue tracking: GitHubâ€¢	Continuous Integration/Tools: GitHub Actionsâ€¢	Infrastructure: we are building on - the Golem Network!, Docker, Prometheus stack
responsibilities-1: Develop reusable, testable, scalable, and efficient code using Rust
Create code requiring low level control
Contribute to the Golem Factory open-source projects @ GitHub
Asynchronous, concurrent, and network programming (TCP, UDP, HTTP)
Develop for all three leading platforms: Linux, macOS, and Windows
Design REST API (low-level Golem API)
Get feedback from the Applications team and SDK team on the above
Contribute to the company Tech Council committee
Test what you write with unit, integration, and manual tests
Attend daily and weekly stand-ups, sprint plannings, retrospectives, 1:1s
Work collaboratively in the CET timezone with other engineers within the team and across teams, especially when working remotely
requirements-1: You can communicate fluently in English
You have multi year experience in design and system programing requiring low level control
You have experience in using Qemu, configuring interaction with external host applications and development
You have experience with implementation of TCP protocol (we maintain own fork of smolTCP library)

You already use and love Rust, including async (but if you have the experience in system programming you do not need to be a Rust developer. Any strongly, statically typed language experience [C++, Java, C#] would be enough to start)
You have experience with asynchronous and concurrent programming
You are skilled with Git, Github, and its tools and the know-how to use them in more significant projects
You have good knowledge of general software design, as well as API design (REST in particular)
You know your way around command-line tools and shell scripting
You are a fast learner and are eager to pick up new technologies and projects

responsibilities-1: Work closely with software developers to ensure the requirements are translated into functional software specifications.
Collaborate with marketing and other stakeholders to understand project goals and objectives.
Elicit, analyze, and document software requirements to ensure they meet the needs of users and comply with regulatory standards.
Work with software quality assurance to ensure that the software meets quality standards and is free from defects.
Collaborate with regulatory and product support teams to ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards.
requirements-1: Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience as a software business analyst, preferably in the medical device industry.
Strong analytical skills and ability to translate complex requirements into functional specifications.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with regulatory requirements for medical device software is a plus.
requirements-expected-1: Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience as a software business analyst, preferably in the medical device industry.
Strong analytical skills and ability to translate complex requirements into functional specifications.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with regulatory requirements for medical device software is a plus.
Software Business Analyst.additional-module-1: We are looking for a skilled and enthusiastic Software Business Analyst to join our team working on the PCRONE medical device project. As a key member of the project team, you will be responsible for ensuring that the software meets the needs of our customers and stakeholders. Power BI Developer.about-project-1: About the projectAs Power BI Developer in FP&A department, you will be responsible for developing, building, and supporting the agreed reports. Results of your work will allow to better understand what has happened in the past, monitor what is happening now (how we as an organization can respond to this), and to be able to analyse possible future scenarios.
responsibilities-1: Generating static reports during the month end closing with agreed frequency, delivering them on time to defined end users
Handling requests from business to improve and modify existing reports and dashboards or create new reports. Estimating the efforts.
Gathering and analyzing finance/business requirements and expectations towards desired reporting and visualizations.
Designing and developing reports within Microsoft Excel, VBA and BI solutions (AfO, Power BI, SAC) where needed basing on the established reporting standards.
Optimization/automation and harmonization of reports. Providing support to other team members.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

responsibilities-1: Developing tools (using mostly C++, Tcl, Qt languages) in the Design for Test (DFT) domain.

Cooperating with peer software developers and other team members in the Poland, Germany, US, and Canada.
Peer code review.
Branch development.
Using Linux, QuestaSim, Tcl, Verilog, Jira, Confluence, Phabricator, Bash, MS Teams.
requirements-1: Background in software development.

Willingness to work independently and as a part of the team.

Student Intern â€“ Tessent Software Deve.offered-1: What we offerWorking tools.Salary.Flexible office hours during the academic year.Nice office with billard, table tenis, playstation ğŸ˜Š or home office (except for the training period in July).Work on implementations as product producer (Siemens), not a partner company.Possible B.Sc./M.Sc. project thesis in cooperation with Siemens EDA.
Student Intern â€“ Tessent Software Deve.additional-module-1: Overview of the positionWorking independently and as a part of one of the teams distributed in Poland, Germany, United States, and Canada that create software aimed at testing components of Integrated Circuits (logic, embedded memories test, etc.), visualization of the results, and data mining for diagnosis and yield ramp. As a part of one of the Tessent Development teams, you will be involved in R&D projects or in enhancement of the tools we produce.We use mostly C++, Qt, Tcl to develop our tools, however in the test infrastructure you will also find PHP, Python, Perl and Bash. Test data is applied through Verilog, VHDL or SystemVerilog so you will develop your HDL (Hardware Description Language) skills as well.While it is expected from the candidate to have a Computer Science and/or Logic Design background, in the first month of the internship you will start with a comprehensive training to improve your knowledge in the DFT domain.

additional-module-3: Possible extension for the entire academic year and beyond (part time).

Senior Xamarin.Forms / .NET MAUI Develop.publication-dates: offer expired over a month ago
Senior Xamarin.Forms / .NET MAUI Develop.about-project-1: About the projectDo you want to work on a product that makes real impact on its users? Would you like change life of people with a hearing loss by developing a mobile healthcare application?Then you may be the Software Engineer we are looking for!You can be a part of our success by joining our R&D team in Warsaw as Senior Xamarin Developer for our End User Apps and help people with hearing loss, by bringing our leading hearing health care solutions to the market. You will work in a growing international company in the medical-technical industry with many opportunities for professional and personal development. You will be part of a dynamic environment built on trust, openness and a strong will to win.The areaIn the role as of Senior Xamarin.Forms / .NET MAUI Developer, you will become a part of the R&D unit Software Solutions (SWS), with development teams in both Poland and Denmark. In SWS, we are developing software for desktop, mobile, wearables (Apple Watch) and cloud solutions enabling our customers to get the most benefit out of our hearing aids.We are working in SAFe framework and we have two ARTs focused on mobile app development and infrastructure around it.We are looking for experienced Xamarin.Forms developer, who will join our team working on development of cross-platform mobile app for Android and iOS devices. The application is an innovative solution allowing tele-medicine and remote control of hearing instruments. We are planning to migrate our solution this year to .NET MAUI.The first release took place on February 9th, 2023 and can be found on Google Play and AppStore under the name Oticon Companion.

Senior Node.js Developer.about-project-1: About the projectWe are currently looking for a Senior Node.js Developer to join Our Client project team in order to provide services in the full life-span of software production, such as: analysis and development of functional specifications, data analysis in source systems, defining business requirements, design, development, post-implementation maintenance of IT systems dedicated to support modern business processes, support in UAT end user tests.Our core tech-stack is: TypeScript, NestJS, Vue.js, Nuxt and TailwindCSS.Additionally, we use MySQL, Redis, BullMQ and occasionally Express, Cypress. We are also in the process of developing a native application in Flutter. On a daily basis we use DigitalOcean services (Apps, Managed Databases, Droplets, S3) which allows us to focus on software development rather than infrastructure maintenance.
